answer:
The Canadian Immunization Guide recommends people 50 years of age and older (without contraindications) who have had shingles, should be vaccinated with Shingrix® (Recombinant Zoster Vaccine) after at least one year from last case of shingles. Please discuss your health history and this vaccine with your primary healthcare provider.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
The Canadian Immunization Guide recommends people 50 years of age and older (without contraindications) who have had shingles, should be vaccinated with Shingrix® (Recombinant Zoster Vaccine) after at least one year from last case of shingles. Please discuss your health history and this vaccine with your primary healthcare provider.
Immunization Nurse
question: I have had shingles twice (sides of trunk) I suffer from PHN periodically. Would getting the vaccine do me any good? I am 74 years old. Thank you.
question_variation_1: can i get vaccine for phn
question_variation_2: does taking the vaccine help shingles
